page.title: 02GEOLOGY
page.content: The area consists mainly of carboniferous limestone with a little Silvnan shale on the Western edge of the block. Due to the porous nature of limestone, rainfall readily drains away. There are a few small streams and in some places these disappear underground through "Swallowholes" e.g. at Hendre Fawr farm (Reference 772098). This underground water system is the source of a powerful spring which emerges at a lower level at "Marian Mills" (Grid Reference 075789) in the adjoining block. This spring provides drinking water for the town of Prestatyn four miles away. There is one lake in the block called "Llyn Helyg", but this was artificially constructed in the 17th Century approximately for sport and recreation.
